data: For practice guidelines, refer to Decision Support Tool (DTS)

Full- term infants - adults
Preterm infants greater than 37 weeks gestation

Indications: Relief of discomfort during procedures such as difficult intravenous (IV) needle insertion or implantable venous access device (IVAD) access,  intramuscular or subcutaneous injection, heel lance, intravenous cannulation, lumbar puncture, bone marrow aspirate and biopsy, dermal surgical procedures
May be initiated only once per patient. If second dose is required at same or subsequent visit then contact MRP

Exceptions / Contraindications: 
- Preterm infants (gestational age less than 37 weeks)
- Patients with congenital or idiopathic methemoglobinemia (a blood disorder)
- Hypersensitivity to any of the other amide type anaesthetics (e.g., lidocaine, prilocaine, lignocaine, mepivicaine, cinchocaine, etidocaine)

Precautions / Special Considerations: 
- Do not apply to cuts, grazes, wounds or where there is a skin rash or eczema
- Do not rub the cream in
- Monitor the application site for degree of numbness
1 application, topical, once, drug form: cream, first dose: NOW
1 patch, topical, once, drug form: patch, first dose: NOW

Full-term infants one month or older - adults
Preterm infants (with a corrected age of greater than one month)
Indications: Procedures include intramuscular or subcutaneous injection, heel lance, intravenous cannulation, lumbar puncture, bone marrow aspirate and biopsy, dermal surgical procedures

Contraindications: Preterm infants less than 1month corrected age
hypersensitivity to local anesthetics of ester type. (e.g. benzocaine, choroprocaine, cocaine, procaine, proparacaine, tetracaine)
1 application, topical, once, drug form: top liq, first dose: NOW
Children 4 years and older (has not been tested in younger children)

Contraindications:
 - For use in immunocompromised patients or prior to drawing blood culture specimens due to the lack of sterility
 - Sterile procedures
- Procedures that last more than 1 minute
- Children who are less then 4 years old or that are not able to understand the ‘cold and numbing’ effect of the spray

Cautions: 
 - Do not use on patients with poor circulation or insensitive skin
- Do not use on large areas of damaged skin, puncture wounds, animal bites or serious wounds
- Do not use on genital mucosal membranes
- Do not use in conjunction with other local anesthetic products (i.e., EMLA or AMETOPP)
- Overspraying may cause frostbite
1 application, topical, once, drug form: top liq, first dose: NOW
Notify treating provider for ongoing therapy
